meanings.definition: The quality of being convenient or practical.
meanings.sent1: She always considered the expediencies of time before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: The expediencies of having a map saved them from getting lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: His obsession with the expediencies of organizing his desk amused his coworkers.
meanings.sent4: The expediencies of using shortcuts in life can sometimes lead to unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The expediencies of packing light for the trip made her journey much easier.

meanings.definition: Means of achieving a particular end, especially one that is convenient or practical.
meanings.sent1: The expediencies of online shopping have revolutionized the way we buy things.
meanings.sent2: In times of crisis, people often resort to the expediencies of finding quick solutions.
meanings.sent3: The detective's unusual expediencies in solving the case left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: The expediencies of a well-thought-out plan can make all the difference in a project's success.
meanings.sent5: His expediencies in negotiating the deal helped close it faster than expected.
